args.natural_language_statement: Show that SL(n) = {A in Mat_{n×n}(ℝ) : det A = 1} is a group under matrix multiplication. Translate to Lean4 code. Import Mathlib at the top. End the Lean4 statement with ":= by sorry" (not a full proof). Use appropriate typeclass assumptions for n (finite index type) and real numbers. Provide a definition of SL and a theorem asserting it has a Group instance (or equivalently is a subgroup) under matrix multiplication.

args.content:
import Mathlib

variable {n : Type _} [Fintype n] [DecidableEq n]

/-- Special linear group SL(n, ℝ) as a set of matrices with determinant 1. -/
def SL : Set (Matrix n n Real) := { A | Matrix.det A = 1 }

/-- The subtype of matrices with determinant 1 carries a group structure under multiplication. -/
noncomputable def SL_group : Group ({ A : Matrix n n Real // Matrix.det A = 1 }) := by
  sorry
